metadata.title: CVE-2012-6702 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Expat, when used in a parser that has not called XML_SetHashSalt or passedit a seed of 0, makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to defeatcryptographic protection mechanisms via vectors involving use of the srandfunction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.3
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.3
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-4ubuntu1.3').
xmlrpc-c package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tla package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
insighttoolkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libxmltok: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
